revised_title: Louis Vessot King: A Life in Physics and Mathematics
tldr: Louis Vessot King was a talented physicist and mathematician who made significant contributions to various fields of physics, including heat convection, hot-wire anemometry, and underwater sound detection. He was also a skilled inventor, creating a tunable diaphragm for fog-alarm systems and a hot-wire anemometer. King's work was recognized with awards and medals, and he held a prestigious position at McGill University. Despite his achievements, his later years were affected by mental illness, which prevented him from continuing his scientific work.
